definition: a plant with yellow flowers whose leaves and seeds have a strong taste and are used in cooking and medicines. Dill is often added to vegetables kept in vinegar.
a bush with small narrow leaves that smell sweet and are used in cooking as a herb
the regular way in which something happens or is done
an excellent example to copy
a regular arrangement of lines, shapes, colours, etc. for example as a design on material, carpets, etc.
a design, set of instructions or shape to cut around that you use in order to make something
a small piece of material, paper, etc. that helps you choose the design of something
the process of writing and testing computer programs
the planning of which television or radio programmes to broadcast
unpleasant
a small flat insect that lives especially in beds, where it bites people and drinks their blood
costing so much that people do not have enough money to pay for it
extremely valuable or important
extremely funny
extremely useful
too great to calculate
one of the levels in karate or judo
a person who has reached a particular level in karate or judo
the sheets and other covers that you put on a bed
the sheets and covers that you put on a bed, and often also the mattress and the pillows
straw, etc. for animals to sleep on
an attractive cover put on top of all the sheets and covers on a bed
connected with or based on statistics
a tall forest tree with smooth grey bark, shiny leaves and small nuts
the wood of the beech tree
a black and grey bird of the crow family
